documents.title: chief constable had a 'remarkable career '
text: i would like to thank him [ mr creedon ] personally and on behalf of our diverse communities .
he has had a remarkable career at local , regional and national level and we all wish him well in the future .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: sports direct 'welcomes conviction ' of 'slavery ' brothers
text: a spokesman for sports direct said : we welcome the conviction of these two individuals , who were brought to justice after being reported to police by the transline agency and sports direct in february 2016 .
`` it sends a clear message that we will not tolerate these kinds of behaviour . ''
transline said that while it had no association with the markowski brothers , a worker complained to the firm , details of which were passed to the police .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: workers 'in constant fear of violence '
text: the markowski brothers were investigated after a man went to police last january and said he had been living at a house in radford boulevard , nottingham , with 10 men who were being exploited .
he said he was being made to work for sports direct in shirebrook and his finances were being controlled the pair .
he told police he had witnessed other workers being beaten by the brothers and was in constant fear of violence .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: chief constable 's retirement announced
text: derbyshire police 's chief constable mick creedon will be retiring after a decade in the post , it has been confirmed .
mr creedon took over as chief constable in 2007 after joining the force in 2003 as an assistant chief constable .
derbyshire police and crime commissioner hardyal dhindsa is now looking for an `` inspirational '' chief constable following mr creedon 's decision to retire .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: two men identified after 'racist remarks ' at rams match
text: derbyshire police said they have identified two men they wanted to speak to about allegations that racist remarks were made during a match between derby county and leeds united .
a group of fans reported some spectators were making racist remarks and gestures to people in the crowd during the rams ' 1-0 win in october .
the force said the two men will be spoken to in due course .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: murder victim 's funeral date set
text: a funeral date has been set for a derby man who died after suffering multiple stab wounds , the derby telegraph reports .
geoff seggie , 59 , was found dead at his home in marylebone crescent , mackworth , during the night on 1 december .
his son , daniel seggie , 31 , of the same address , has been charged with his murder .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: derby loan striker vernam to coventry
text: derby county has loaned out striker charles vernam to league one bottom side coventry city for the rest of the season .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: four-lane section on m1 'dangerous '
text: the four-lane motorway system on the m1 is dangerous , according to a retired derbyshire traffic officer .
the hard shoulder between junctions 28 and 31 has been replaced by a permanent fourth lane .
retired policeman ian windmill told bbc radio derby not having a hard shoulder to use as an emergency lane is not safe .
highways england responded by saying it will continue to monitor that section of the m1 .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: brothers had 'planned and systematic scheme '
text: during sentencing , judge stephen coupland , said : `` it was a planned and systematic scheme to traffic others , for you to control them and benefit from their hard work , whilst they received very little and lived in poor conditions . ''
he said many of the workers were `` vulnerable '' so while they were not forced to work they agreed to continue .
the markowskis also withdrew money from their bank accounts , leaving them with small amounts .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: sports direct worker felt 'like a piece of rubbish '
text: during sentencing the court heard the pair obtained more than £ 35,000 by exploiting workers .
more than one victim spoke of being treated `` like a piece of rubbish '' , and said they `` destroyed their lives '' .

judge stephen coupland said erwin markowski , 37 , of cedar road , nottingham , and krystian markowski , 35 , from harcourt road , nottingham , purposely selected vulnerable people to make it easier to control them .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: cps : brothers 'preyed ' on vulnerable
text: speaking after the brothers ' sentencing , janine smith , chief crown prosecutor of crown prosecution service east midlands , said : `` the markowskis preyed on vulnerable people in poland and promised them accommodation and a tempting wage in order to lure them to the uk .
`` the reality upon arrival was a life of squalid living conditions and near total control by the defendants . ''
author: Danny Shaw
BBC Home Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: six years in prison for brothers
text: erwin and krystian markowski were each given a six year jail term for conspiring to arrange or facilitate travel with a view to exploitation , an offence under the modern slavery act .
the pair were given a two-and-a-half year sentence for an offence of fraud by false representation , to run at the same time as the six years .
author: Danny Shaw
BBC Home Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: breakingbrothers jailed for 'modern slavery '
text: erwin and krystian markowski have both been jailed at nottingham crown court for six years for `` modern slavery '' .
they recruited 18 vulnerable men in poland then controlled their bank accounts and kept most of their wages .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: education secretary to visit derby train maker
text: education secretary justine greening will be visiting derby-based train maker bombardier this afternoon .
she 'll be talking to apprentices at the company .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: youths 'tried to rob two friends '
text: a group of youths - some as young as 10 years old - tried to rob two friends in allestree , derbyshire police said .
two 16-year-old boys were walking along carsington crescent at about 18:15 on 19 january when they were approached by the group , some of whom were on bicycles .
the group demanded the pair hand over their property and when they refused , they were assaulted .
people living on the street then came out of their houses and the group left empty-handed .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: protest at council running of cafe
text: a number of people who use the mad hatters cafe in alvaston park have said they 'll no longer go there when derby city council takes over the running of it .
it 's been owned by dawn ford and claire whetton for six years , but the council wo n't renew their lease when it ends in march .
the council said it wants , where possible , to have catering at its park cafes under one operator .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: brothers admit conning sports direct agency workers
text: two polish brothers have admitted conning and threatening agency workers , who they sent to sports direct 's warehouse in shirebrook .
erwin and krystian markowski recruited 18 vulnerable men in poland , then controlled their bank accounts and kept most of their wages .
the prosecution accepted it was n't `` forced labour '' , but said the workers had `` very little choice '' .
they 'll be sentenced this afternoon .
author: Jeremy Ball
Social affairs correspondent, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: vet calls for action on dumped horses
text: a vet is calling for more to be done to prevent horses being dumped after three were left near little eaton in derby last week .
it follows the recent discovery of dead or dying animals in calverton , nottinghamshire and shirebrook in derbyshire .
janice dixon , of charity help for horses , said existing laws on microchipping were not being enforced .
she said : dumping a horse breaks laws on fly-tipping , microchipping and animal cruelty , yet no one wants to stop it . ''
author: Greig Watson
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: british cycling 'devastated ' by boy 's death
text: british cycling 's programmes director andy harrison said the organisation was `` devastated by the news '' .
`` charlie was a promising young rider who had his whole life ahead of him , '' mr harrison said .
`` everyone involved with the team is devastated by this news and , naturally , all of our thoughts are with charlie 's family . ''
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'went to sleep but never woke up '
text: charlie was a rider at apprentice level with the gb cycling team 's rider route and won the under-16 national trophy cyclocross series in 2016 .
the boy 's father , nick craig , himself a national cyclocross champion , broke the news on facebook saying the family 's world had fallen apart , cycling weekly reported .
`` our beautiful lovely little boy charlie went to sleep but never woke up , '' mr craig said on facebook .
`` i do n't know what else to write just now , but he will be with his little angel niece . ''
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'promising ' young cyclist , 15 , 'dies in his sleep '
text: the cycling world is in shock after a 15-year-old rider apparently died in his sleep .
charlie craig , from derbyshire , won a national title last year and was tipped as one for the future .
many tributes have been posted including from dame sarah storey who tweeted that his death was a tragic loss '' .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: man , 44 , 'attacked by men he did not know '
text: a 44-year-old man was attacked by a group of strangers in clay cross , derbyshire police said .
the man had to be taken to hospital for treatment after the assault , which officers say took place between 17:00 and 17:30 on january 9 .
details have only just been released by police .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'pawlates ' aims to tackle long-term health problems
text: dennis dennis , the active canine in the video , has passed the beginners and advanced `` pawlates '' classes which take place every week at ashover village hall .
his owner , allison dennis , from ashover , said her wire hair fox terrier will replicate the tricks he 's learned in class at home .
the classes were devised by two animals experts , one of whom was originally a vet nurse who wanted to help dogs before surgical procedures to keep fit and avoid long-term health problems .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

text: mr wilson has said , following the incident , more people should be taught basic life support training .
matlock town said in a statement : `` the early intervention by club volunteers and supporters , including a nurse and a doctor , inevitably played a huge part in the recovery of the supporter . ''
author: Alex Smith

documents.title: retired doctor saves life of football fan
text: a retired doctor reportedly saved the life of a football fan who collapsed over the weekend .
the matlock town supporter fell ill at the club 's home match against workington afc on saturday .
dr simon wilson , who had travelled to the game from cumbria , performed cpr until the emergency services arrived .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: fog affecting flights this morning
text: east midlands airport says fog and poor visibility is affecting flights this morning .
they have advised passengers to check the status of their flights with their airline before travelling to the airport .
the airport said passengers should expect delays to flights and cancellations of some short haul and domestic uk flights .
author: Sandish Shoker
BBC News Online

documents.title: parents may have 'suffered appalling injustice '
text: mr bache said : `` the parents may well have suffered the most appalling injustice .
`` if the anomalies that were identified were , in fact naturally occurring , then they 've had their children taken away from them for absolutely no good reason whatsoever .
`` if a parent suffers it , then it may well be that the children will also inherit it .
and i believe there are a lot of cases where this connection might be very important indeed to the resolution of what has actually happened to the children . ''
the mother said : `` having received the ehlers-danlos [ syndrome ] diagnosis this can easily now explain my son 's condition when presented to hospital . ''
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: condition 'can cause severe bruising '
text: then , two years ago , she was diagnosed with ehlers-danlos syndrome [ eds ] .
the genetic , inheritable condition affects the joints in the body .
it can also cause skin to damage easily , can be slow to heal and can sometimes cause severe bruising , according to kay julier , managing director of the charity ehlers-danlos support uk .

leading solicitor bill bache ( previously represented angela cannings - a mother at the centre of a high-profile miscarriage of justice case whose wrongful conviction for murdering her two babies was overturned in 2003 .
author: Alex Smith

documents.title: no criminal case to answer
text: in december 2008 , the crown prosecution service said there was no criminal case to answer , according to derbyshire police .
however , a family court fact-finding hearing - held a year later - judged the children to be at risk and they were subsequently adopted .
the mother requested hospital medical records .
one stated there was no fracture , while another stated it was more likely to be a fissure than a fracture .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: 'daddy please save me '
text: the father said the moment they were taken into care was `` the worst day of his life '' .
`` to hear your child screaming , 'daddy please save me ' , and knowing there 's nothing at all you can do , it just kills you , '' he said .
`` you just stop living because you are ripped apart . ''
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online

documents.title: adopted sons 'unjustly ' taken from parents
text: a couple whose two sons were taken into care and adopted may be victims of a miscarriage of justice , says a solicitor .
the couple had taken their nine-month-old son to hospital after noticing `` boggy swelling '' on his head in september 2008 .
after a scan , the parents said they were told there was a skull fracture and signs of previous bleeding on the brain .
a month later , their sons - then aged 10 months and three years - were taken into care by derbyshire county council .
author: Alex Smith
BBC News Online
